name: Earthjustice
mission: Earthjustice is the premier nonprofit public interest environmental law organization. We wield the power of law and the strength of partnership to prote...
programs: Clean Energy and a Stable Climate
theoryOfChange: Earthjustice has a published 'justice framework' which they describe as an 'Ecosystem of Justice' that aims to achieve a truly democratic multi-racial society, incorporating and serving all people and the planet. This framework guides their work and vision, emphasizing justice, partnership, inclusion, and excellence as core values. They also explicitly state a 'theory of change' in the context of their efforts to transition away from coal-fired power plants, where forcing environmental compliance makes coal economically uncompetitive with clean energy sources. Furthermore, Earthjustice's 'Our Work' section refers to a 'Strategic Plan' and outlines their goals, which include ending fossil fuel extraction, powering with 100% clean energy, securing clean air and water for all, building a justice-centered environmental movement, removing toxic chemicals, farming sustainably, safeguarding lands and waters, and protecting biodiversity.

all_citations.claim: Earthjustice focuses on environmental law, capacity building, and maintains specific financial metrics including working capital and cost per beneficiary.
The organization reported total revenue of $125,960,142 and a program expense ratio of 80.2%.
The organization accepts general charitable donations (sadaqah) to support its legal and environmental programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Earthjustice maintains strong financial health and efficiency, though its overall score is moderated by the high-cost nature of legal advocacy and a lower alignment with specific donor demographics.
areas_for_improvement: High cost per beneficiary due to the nature of long-term legal advocacy and capacity building
Low direct alignment for donors seeking traditional humanitarian or Muslim-specific cause areas

dimension_explanations.alignment: As an advocacy-focused organization, the cause urgency is high for environmental protection, yet donor fit is considered low for those seeking direct humanitarian aid [1]. Contributions are recognized as sadaqah-eligible for those wishing to support environmental justice through general charitable giving [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on capacity building and advocacy, resulting in a cost per beneficiary of 118249.374 [1]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 80.2% and 19.3 months of working capital, the long-term nature of legal work makes direct impact measurement more complex than traditional service delivery [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Earthjustice is a premier nonprofit public interest law organization dedicated to wielding the power of law to protect the environment and healthy communities.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 80.2% ensures the majority of funds support legal and environmental programs
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.12 per $1 raised
Robust financial stability with 19.3 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: Operating as a non-profit legal powerhouse, Earthjustice focuses on protecting the wild and building healthy communities through strategic litigation and partnership [1][2]. The organization reported a total revenue of $125,960,142 to support its mission of environmental advocacy and legal defense [2].

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains strong governance with a 100% independent board and regular financial audits.

case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">low cost-efficiency per individual</cite> and a lack of direct humanitarian focus.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data from 2023; Impact reports from 2025
confidence.notes: Strong financial transparency and documented theory of change.

known_gaps: Not fully rated by Charity Navigator

alignment.explanation: While the charity serves <cite id="7">underserved populations</cite> and operates in some Muslim-majority regions, its primary focus is <cite id="3">environmental advocacy</cite> rather than humanitarian relief.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Earthjustice due to its <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency</cite> and its <cite id="12">100% independent board</cite> of 33 members. The organization has a <cite id="11">verified track record</cite> of environmental victories dating back to 1971.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could seek full rating status from all major evaluators to provide more granular accountability metrics.

impact.explanation: The organization maintains a <cite id="6">80.2% program expense ratio</cite>, which is competitive within the advocacy sector. However, the <cite id="14">$118,249 cost per beneficiary</cite> reflects the expensive nature of high-level litigation.
impact.improvement: Impact efficiency could be improved by <cite id="10">optimizing working capital reserves</cite> to ensure more funds are actively deployed in active litigation rather than held in excess reserves.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Documented Theory of Change and Outcome Tracking

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports partner organizations and advocacy actions aligned with legal goals

rich_narrative.headline: Earthjustice is a premier nonprofit public interest law organization dedicated to wielding the power of law to protect the environment and healthy communities.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize long-term systemic change through the legal system and want to support environmental justice for underserved communities.
donor_motivations: Value the power of law to protect the environment
Want to support justice-centered environmental movements
Prefer funding systemic advocacy over direct humanitarian aid
Value established institutions with 50+ years of experience
giving_considerations: Donations support long-term legal battles rather than immediate relief
The organization holds very high cash reserves
Impact is measured in policy and legal wins rather than individual lives saved
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those looking for immediate, high-volume humanitarian service delivery.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks outcomes through <cite id="15">social media engagement</cite> and <cite id="16">educational curriculum usage</cite>, alongside its legal win-loss record.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Earthjustice uses strategic litigation to enforce environmental laws, aiming to shift the energy economy and protect public health through judicial precedents.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In advocacy, evidence of success is found in legal precedents and policy shifts that protect millions of people simultaneously.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While revenue has grown at a <cite id="17">4.7% CAGR</cite>, the organization already holds significant assets to fund its operations.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="12">large 33-member board</cite> and focus on <cite id="5">strategic litigation</cite> over general activism.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Heavier focus on scientific research and policy
similar_organizations.name: Union of Concerned Scientists

strengths.detail: Earthjustice directs <cite id="6">79.9% of its total expenses</cite> toward its environmental programs and legal advocacy.
The organization demonstrates high efficiency in resource acquisition, spending only <cite id="9">$0.12 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The charity maintains <cite id="10">19.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing a robust buffer for long-term legal battles.

strengths_deep_dive: Earthjustice's strength lies in its institutional maturity and specialized focus. Having operated for over 50 years, it has developed a <cite id="11">documented theory of change</cite> that centers on high-stakes litigation. Its governance is supported by an <cite id="12">independent board of 33 members</cite>, ensuring diverse oversight. Furthermore, the organization holds a <cite id="13">Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting a commitment to public accountability and data sharing.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1971</cite>, Earthjustice has established itself as a premier nonprofit public interest law organization dedicated to protecting the environment and healthy communities. The organization operates with a significant financial footprint, reporting <cite id="2">$125,960,142 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. Earthjustice utilizes a strategic litigation model, leveraging the power of the law to <cite id="3">end the extraction of fossil fuels</cite> and <cite id="4">secure clean air and water as rights for all</cite>. Their work is structured around building a justice-centered environmental movement, often through <cite id="5">partnerships with local communities</cite> to remove toxic chemicals from daily life. Financially, the organization maintains a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 80.2%</cite>, indicating that the vast majority of its resources are directed toward its core legal and advocacy programs. While the organization is a major player in the domestic environmental space, it also maintains an international reach, serving regions including <cite id="7">South America and South Africa</cite>. As a legal powerhouse, Earthjustice does not provide direct humanitarian aid but rather focuses on <cite id="8">capacity building and systemic change</cite> through the judicial system.
